column1: Schinnen (Dutch pronunciation: [ˈsxɪnə(n)] (listen); Limburgish: Sjènne) is a town and was a municipality in the province of Limburg
column2: the Netherlands.  It is home to US Army Garrison Schinnen
column3: a support base for US personnel assigned to nearby Allied Joint Force Command Brunssum.  It is also the location of Alfa Brewery
column4: the only brewery in the Netherlands that uses an officially certified underground spring. In 2019
column5: it merged with Nuth and Onderbanken to form Beekdaelen.
